alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:10PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Chase County through 445 PM CDT... At 410 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Cottonwood Falls, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood Falls, Strong City, Elmdale, Saffordville, Tallgrass Prairie and Tallgrass Prairie Preserve. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 109 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
